instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged / black screen
threads.message: I have a 2015 Mac air that came in dead, had a tiny liquid spil on <CAPACITOR>C5126</CAPACITOR>. After replacing boots up. Customer came back 2 days later telling me it froze. Now ive been playing youtube for about 5 hours, and the display went black. Display has 24v so backlight is powered. Fan still spinning. If i reboot works normal again. Board looks pretty clean, also around the display connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged / black screen
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal when black screen.
It still has USB activity in that moment?

Did you try another screen and or video cable?
PRAM reset done?

Clean/replace LCD connector.
